arm_group.description: Control trial to determine the impact of the ischemic injury on vascular function without intervention
Trial to determine the impact of an antioxidant load before the ischemic injury on vascular function recovery
Trial to determine the impact of a non-selective prostaglandin inhibitor before the ischemic injury on vascular function recovery
Trial to determine the impact of an antioxidant load and prostaglandin inhibitor before the ischemic injury on vascular function recovery

brief_summary.textblock:
The purposes of this study are two-fold. The first purpose is to determine the effect of
      taking vitamins on the recovery of an artery (blood vessel) following an induced temporary
      injury. The second purpose is to determine whether a specific vasodilator is less abundant
      after the injury and whether this contributes to increased constriction or after the injury.
      Finally, does vitamin consumption have an effect on the recovery from the injury if one of
      the substances in the blood that causes vessels to enlarge (dilate) is stopped?

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy males

          -  Healthy females

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Smokers

          -  Cardiovascular disease

          -  Peripheral vascular disease

          -  Neurological deficits

          -  Diabetes Type I or II

          -  Pregnant women

          -  Adverse reactions to Ibuprofen

clinical_study.official_title: The Role of Prostaglandin and Anti-oxidant Availability on Recovery From Forearm Ischemia-reperfusion Injury in Humans

primary_outcome.description: Flow mediated dilation is a measure of vascular function and is measured as the outcome before and after an injury to the inner lining of the artery.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 15 minutes after ischemia-reperfusion injury

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: low flow mediated constriction is a measure of vascular function and is measured to establish the impact of a vascular injury
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in low flow mediated constriction
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline at 15 minutes after ischemia-reperfusion injury

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Basic Science
